covered_call.name: Covered Call
covered_call.description: Own 100 shares of stock and sell a call option against it to collect premium. Stock may be called away if price rises.
covered_call.max_loss: Stock price decline (partially offset by premium)
best_for: Want to generate income from existing holdings
Willing to sell stock at higher price
setup_steps: Sell 1 call option at strike price above current price
management_rules: Roll up and out if stock rises past strike
Monitor for early assignment before dividends
Consider closing if stock drops significantly
examples: Stock: XYZ at $50, Sell 1 call at $55 strike, 30-45 days out
Premium collected: $1.50 per share ($150 total)
Max profit: $150 premium + $500 if called away = $650
warnings: ⚠️ Stock may be called away if price rises above strike
covered_call.notes: Great income strategy for stock owners. Provides downside protection through premium collected.

cash_secured_put.name: Cash-Secured Put
cash_secured_put.description: Sell a put option with cash to secure the obligation. Collect premium and potentially buy stock at lower price.
cash_secured_put.max_loss: Strike price - premium (if stock goes to $0)
best_for: Wanting to own stock at lower price
Willing to own stock at strike price
cash_secured_put.stop_loss: Close if stock drops significantly below strike
setup_steps: Have cash equal to 100 shares × strike price
Sell 1 put option at desired entry price
management_rules: Roll down and out if stock approaches strike
Be prepared to buy stock if assigned
examples: Stock: ABC at $100, Sell 1 put at $95 strike, 30-45 days out
Premium collected: $2.00 per share ($200 total)
Cash reserved: $9,500
warnings: ⚠️ Obligated to buy stock if price drops below strike
cash_secured_put.notes: Excellent strategy for buying stocks you want at a discount. Part of The Wheel strategy.

long_call.name: Long Call (Stock Replacement)
long_call.description: Buy a call option, typically deep in-the-money, as a capital-efficient alternative to owning stock.
setup_steps: Buy 1 call option, typically 60-90 days out
Use deep in-the-money calls for stock replacement
examples: Stock: DEF at $50, Buy 1 call at $45 strike, 90 days out
Premium paid: $7.00 per share ($700 total)
Max profit: Unlimited if stock rises
long_call.notes: Capital-efficient way to get bullish exposure. Use deep ITM calls for stock replacement.

long_put.name: Long Put (Portfolio Protection)
long_put.description: Buy a put option to protect existing stock positions or profit from stock decline.
setup_steps: Buy 1 put option at or below current price
examples: Own 100 shares of GHI at $60, Buy 1 put at $55 strike, 60-90 days out
Premium paid: $2.50 per share ($250 total)
Protects against losses below $55
long_put.notes: Excellent for portfolio protection. Acts as insurance against stock decline.

wheel_strategy.name: The Wheel Strategy
wheel_strategy.description: Three-step income strategy: 1) Sell cash-secured put, 2) If assigned, own stock, 3) Sell covered calls on owned stock. Repeat.
wheel_strategy.max_loss: Stock price decline (partially offset by premiums)
best_for: Income generation with stocks you like
Willing to own and manage stock positions
setup_steps: Step 1: Sell cash-secured put on stock you want to own
Step 2: If assigned, own 100 shares of stock
Step 3: Sell covered calls on owned stock
Step 4: If called away, repeat from Step 1
management_rules: Choose stocks you're willing to own long-term
Roll puts down and out if tested
Roll calls up and out if tested
examples: Week 1-2: Sell put on JKL at $50, collect $150
If assigned: Own 100 shares at $50
Week 3-4: Sell call at $52, collect $100
If called away: Sell stock at $52, profit $200 + $250 premium
warnings: ⚠️ Must be willing to own stock
⚠️ Can tie up capital for extended periods
wheel_strategy.notes: Excellent income strategy for patient investors. Combines put selling and covered calls.

bull_call_spread.name: Bull Call Spread
bull_call_spread.description: Buy a call at lower strike and sell a call at higher strike (same expiration). Limited risk and reward.
best_for: Expect moderate rise in stock price
setup_steps: Sell 1 call at higher strike (same expiration)
examples: Stock: PQR at $50, Buy $50 call for $3, Sell $55 call for $1
Net cost: $200
Max profit: $300 (if stock at $55+)
bull_call_spread.notes: Great for moderate bullish plays with defined risk. Lower cost than long calls.

bear_put_spread.name: Bear Put Spread
bear_put_spread.description: Buy a put at higher strike and sell a put at lower strike (same expiration). Limited risk and reward.
best_for: Expect moderate decline in stock price
setup_steps: Sell 1 put at lower strike (same expiration)
examples: Stock: STU at $50, Buy $50 put for $3, Sell $45 put for $1
Net cost: $200
Max profit: $300 (if stock at $45-)
bear_put_spread.notes: Great for moderate bearish plays with defined risk. Lower cost than long puts.

iron_condor.name: Iron Condor
iron_condor.description: Sell OTM call spread above stock and OTM put spread below stock. Collect net credit. Profit if stock stays between strikes.
best_for: Expect stock to stay in range
examples: Stock: VWX at $100, Sell $110/$115 call spread, Sell $90/$85 put spread
Total credit: $200
Max profit: $200 if stock stays between $90-$110
warnings: ⚠️ Requires stock to stay in range
iron_condor.notes: Excellent neutral strategy for high IV environments. Defined risk and reward.

calendar_spread.name: Calendar Spread (Time Spread)
calendar_spread.description: Sell near-term option and buy longer-term option at same strike. Profit from time decay differential.
best_for: Expect stock to stay near strike
setup_steps: Choose ATM or slightly OTM strikes
examples: Stock: YZA at $50, Sell $50 call 30 days for $2, Buy $50 call 90 days for $4
Net cost: $200
Profit if short expires worthless
warnings: ⚠️ Requires stock to stay near strike
⚠️ Time decay works against long leg
calendar_spread.notes: Great for time decay plays. Requires stock to stay near strike at short expiration.

short_straddle.name: Short Straddle
short_straddle.description: Sell 1 call and 1 put at-the-money (same expiration). Collect premium. Profit if stock stays flat.
short_straddle.max_loss: Unlimited (on call side), substantial (on put side)
examples: Stock: BCD at $100, Sell $100 call for $4, Sell $100 put for $4
Total credit: $800
Max profit: $800 if stock stays at $100
short_straddle.notes: High-risk strategy for experienced traders. Requires stock to stay exactly flat.

short_strangle.name: Short Strangle
short_strangle.description: Sell 1 OTM call and 1 OTM put (same expiration). Collect premium. Profit if stock stays between strikes.
short_strangle.max_loss: Unlimited (on call side), substantial (on put side)
best_for: Expect stock to stay within wide range
Want wider profit zone than straddle
examples: Stock: EFG at $100, Sell $110 call for $2, Sell $90 put for $2
Total credit: $400
Max profit: $400 if stock stays between $90-$110
short_strangle.notes: Wider profit zone than straddle but still high risk. Better for range-bound markets.

butterfly_spread.name: Butterfly Spread
butterfly_spread.description: Buy 1 call at lower strike, sell 2 calls at middle strike, buy 1 call at higher strike. Profit if stock at middle strike.
butterfly_spread.max_gain: Middle strike - lower strike - net debit
best_for: Expect stock to be at middle strike at expiration
examples: Stock: HIJ at $50, Buy $45 call for $7, Sell 2x $50 calls for $8, Buy $55 call for $2
Net cost: $100
Max profit: $400 if stock at $50
warnings: ⚠️ Early assignment risk on short calls
butterfly_spread.notes: Precise strategy requiring stock to be exactly at middle strike. Low cost, high reward potential.

iron_butterfly.name: Iron Butterfly
iron_butterfly.description: Sell call and put at-the-money, buy call and put further OTM. Net credit. Profit if stock stays at middle strike.
examples: Stock: KLM at $50, Sell $50 call for $3, Sell $50 put for $3, Buy $55 call for $1, Buy $45 put for $1
Net credit: $400
Max profit: $400 if stock stays at $50
warnings: ⚠️ Requires stock to stay exactly at middle strike
iron_butterfly.notes: Combines straddle and butterfly. Requires precise stock movement for max profit.

poor_mans_covered_call.name: Poor Man's Covered Call (PMCC)
poor_mans_covered_call.description: Buy a deep ITM LEAPS call and sell shorter-term OTM calls against it. Capital-efficient alternative to covered calls.
poor_mans_covered_call.max_loss: Net debit paid (LEAPS cost - credits collected)
poor_mans_covered_call.max_gain: Limited to short call strike - long call strike - net debit
best_for: Want covered call benefits without buying 100 shares
Lower capital requirement than traditional covered call
poor_mans_covered_call.typical_dte: Long leg: 12-24 months (LEAPS), Short leg: 30-45 days
poor_mans_covered_call.stop_loss: Close if stock drops significantly below long call strike
setup_steps: Buy deep ITM call (Delta 0.70-0.80) with 12-24 months to expiration
Sell OTM call (Delta 0.20-0.30) with 30-45 days to expiration
Ensure long call strike is lower than short call strike
Net debit should be significantly less than buying 100 shares
management_rules: Roll short call when it reaches 50-75% profit or at 21 DTE
If stock drops significantly, consider closing entire position
If stock rises past short call, can roll up and out for credit
Monitor long call value - should maintain extrinsic value
examples: Stock at $100: Buy $80 call (24 months) for $25, Sell $110 call (45 days) for $2
Net cost: $2,300 vs $10,000 for 100 shares
Collect $200/month selling calls against LEAPS
warnings: ⚠️ Long call loses value if stock drops significantly
⚠️ Requires active management of short calls
⚠️ Early assignment risk on short calls (especially before dividends)
⚠️ Less profitable than covered calls in strong bull markets
poor_mans_covered_call.notes: Great strategy for bullish traders with limited capital. Mimics covered call mechanics with 70-80% less capital.

jade_lizard.name: Jade Lizard
jade_lizard.description: Sell an OTM call spread and an OTM put. No upside risk, profit if stock stays flat or rises moderately.
jade_lizard.stop_loss: 2x credit received or stock breaks put strike
setup_steps: Buy further OTM call to cap upside risk
Ensure total credit > width of call spread (eliminates upside risk)
management_rules: Close at 50% profit to reduce risk
If stock drops toward put, consider rolling put down and out
If stock rises, call spread provides protection
Monitor for early assignment on short options
examples: Stock at $100: Sell $95 put for $2, Sell $110 call for $2, Buy $115 call for $0.50
Net credit: $3.50 ($350 per contract)
No upside risk since credit ($3.50) > call spread width ($5)
warnings: ⚠️ Significant downside risk if stock drops
⚠️ Requires margin for naked put component
⚠️ Best in high IV - credit must exceed call spread width
jade_lizard.notes: Advanced neutral strategy that eliminates upside risk. Named after the jade lizard which has no natural predators from above.
